etymology.description: 豆瓣 ‘split/broad-bean pieces’ + 酱 ‘sauce/paste’ = sauce made from fermented bean pieces, often with chili.
etymology.interpretation: Names a thick fermented condiment based on split broad beans, commonly blended with chilies, salt, and wheat flour. Highlights the visible bean fragments (瓣) that give texture and depth of flavor.
etymology.simplification: 酱 was simplified from 醬 by streamlining the 酉 radical and using 将 as the phonetic, reducing strokes while preserving sound and meaning; 豆瓣 is unchanged.

parts.english: bean halves; split broad beans; broad-bean pieces; fermented broad-bean chunks
sauce; paste; thick condiment; bean-based sauce

examples.chinese: 这道回锅肉离不开郫县豆瓣酱(這道回鍋肉離不開郫縣豆瓣醬)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào huíguōròu lí bù kāi Píxiàn dòubànjiàng.
examples.english: Twice-cooked pork depends on Pixian doubanjiang.

examples.chinese: 他用豆瓣酱炒辣椒(他用豆瓣醬炒辣椒)，香味很浓(香味很濃)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng dòubànjiàng chǎo làjiāo, xiāngwèi hěn nóng.
examples.english: He stir-fries chilies with doubanjiang, and the aroma is intense.

examples.chinese: 超市里有不同牌子的豆瓣酱(超市裡有不同牌子的豆瓣醬)。
examples.pinyin: Chāoshì lǐ yǒu bùtóng páizi de dòubànjiàng.
examples.english: The supermarket carries different brands of doubanjiang.
